summary: Medicare Advantage organizations—which offer a private health plan alternative to traditional Medicare—were paid about $170 billion by the federal government and served nearly one-third of all Medicare beneficiaries in 2015. To help ensure appropriate payments, the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services collects data on the care and health status of Medicare Advantage enrollees. We previously reported that CMS had not fully validated these data...
title: Medicare Advantage: Limited Progress Made to Validate Encounter Data Used to Ensure Proper Payments
